missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} Tiles not yet placed in the map are obscured tiles.
{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space that would be adjacent to a space on an obscured tile, click the respective highlight and select "Reveal".
{-} A hero can interact with a terminal to claim it. After he does, that hero may test {I}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points.
{-} The door to the Cell is locked. When the heroes have claimed 4 terminals, the door to the Cell unlocks.
{-} When a hero withdraws, he is incapacitated instead. When activating, he receives only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Cell opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

events.eventText:
Surveilling the squat, nondescript structure for any sign of the missing Rebel team, you determine the building to be a local prisoner holding facility. The unusual number of Imperial troops around the facility indicate more than low-level criminals are being held inside. Carefully observing the patrol routes of the facility's security forces, you wait  until nightfall to make your move.

A well-placed explosive cuts power to the facility, which goes dark for a brief moment before the emergency generators kick in. Much of the facility is dimly lit by weak emergency lights, and all but the most essential security systems are offline. You need only disable the remaining systems and find out if and where the other Rebel team is being held.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Tiles not yet placed in the map are obscured tiles.
{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space that would be adjacent to a space on an obscured tile, click the respective highlight and select "Reveal".
{-} A hero can interact with a terminal to claim it. After he does, that hero may test {I}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points.
{-} The door to the Cell is locked. When the heroes have claimed 4 terminals, the door to the Cell unlocks.
{-} When a hero withdraws, he is incapacitated instead. When activating, he receives only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Cell opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

You lay down cover fire as the prisoners pile into your getaway speeder, then climb aboard yourself. “Thank you for coming for us,” one of the Rebels says. “We have to continue our mission to find this shard of the Bardottan sphere - with your help, if you are willing."

The team leader fills you in on leads the team had come across before being caught, including a Jedi historian named Lorn who has knowledge of Force artifacts, and an Imperial officer named Zaaryn who is looking to sell information about the shard on the black market.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Heroes earn 1 non-unique ally of their choice.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Heroes must choose to either pursue Lorn or track Zaaryn. If the heroes pursue Lorn, place Story Mission card “Double Agent” into play, If they track Zaaryn, place Story Mission card “Disruption” into play.

You flee the facility in a hail of blaster fire. A dogged pursuit through the streets of Coruscant forces you to split up, regrouping later back at your hideout. You risk several calls to the other Rebel team's safe house, hopeful at least one of them made it back, but get no response.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} The threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

events.eventText:
When the cell door slides open, the lights kick back on and alarms begin to blare as main power is restored to the facility.

“We weren't sure you'd find us!” one of the Rebels exclaims as your eyes adjust to the bright light. Each of the Rebels has their arms and legs shackled. They're going to need your help escaping.

{-} A hero can interact with a captive to claim it. Each hero can claim only 2 captives. Once during his activation, a hero can test {K}. If he succeeds, he may interact with 1 captive without using an action.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: Door to the Cell

eventActions.tbText: The Imperial soldiers hastily erect a huge blaster cannon outside the facility.
Now that you have found your companions, you need to escape the facility.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: {-} When 4 captives have been claimed and all heroes are on exterior spaces, click "Extract".

eventActions.tbText:
{-} The Rebel mission token represents the escape route.
{-} When 4 captives have been claimed and all heroes are on exterior spaces, click the escape route and select "Extract".
{-} The Rebels win when they are extracted.

eventActions.theText:
{-} A hero can interact with a captive to claim it. Each hero can claim only 2 captives. Once during his activation, a hero can test {K}. If he succeeds, he may interact with 1 captive without using an action.
{-} When a hero withdraws, he is incapacitated instead. When activating, he receives only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} The Rebel mission token represents the escape route.
{-} When 4 captives have been claimed and all heroes are on exterior spaces, click the escape route and select "Extract".
{-} The Rebels win when they are extracted.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.tbText:
As the power returns and the facility is flooded with bright lights, at least it's now easier to find your way around.

{-} Reveal all remaining obscured tiles.

events.eventText:
You manage to wrest the chains from the wall, but can't break the shackles. You're going to have to carry Zan.

{-} Claim this token.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: {-} A hero can interact with a captive to claim it. Each hero can claim only 2 captives. Once during his activation, a hero can test {K}. If he succeeds, he may interact with 1 captive without using an action.

events.eventText:
With your help, Commander Uyem struggles to her feet, but immediately collapses again. She manages to rise, but leans heavily on you.

{-} Claim this token.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Lorenn Uyem, the human commander of the Rebel team, looks battered and bloody. She has apparently been subjected to cruel interrogations. She can barely walk.

{-} A hero can interact with a captive to claim it. Each hero can claim only 2 captives. Once during his activation, a hero can test {K}. If he succeeds, he may interact with 1 captive without using an action.

events.eventText:
Ioryn doesn't stir when you pick him up. For a second you fear he might be dead, but he is still breathing weakly.

{-} Claim this token.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Ioryn Neram, the Drall slicer, is unconscious, clutching a wound in his chest.

{-} A hero can interact with a captive to claim it. Each hero can claim only 2 captives. Once during his activation, a hero can test {K}. If he succeeds, he may interact with 1 captive without using an action.

events.eventText:
Leaning on you, Mir looks grimly determined to escape the facility as soon as possible.

{-} Claim this token.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Mir Uilana, the Quarren technician, has had his legs broken, but looks otherwise in good spirits.

{-} A hero can interact with a captive to claim it. Each hero can claim only 2 captives. Once during his activation, a hero can test {K}. If he succeeds, he may interact with 1 captive without using an action.

events.eventText:
You quickly deactivate the security terminal.

{-} Test {I}. If you succeed, you gain 2 movement points.

The terminal is working on emergency power, its small lights blinking rapidly.

{-} A hero can interact with a terminal to claim it. After he does, that hero may test {I}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points.

events.eventText:
You finally shut down the security systems.

{-} The door to the cell is now unlocked.

eventActions.shortText: Open the door to the cell.

{-} Tiles not yet placed in the map are obscured tiles.
{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space that would be adjacent to a space on an obscured tile, click the respective highlight and select "Reveal".

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The door to the cell lies in darkness. Weak voices can be heard from behind.

events.eventText:
You have rescued your companions. Now it's time to hurry out.

{-} When 4 captives have been claimed and all heroes are on exterior spaces, click the escape route and select "Extract".

translatedEntityProperties.theText: {-} When 4 captives have been claimed and all heroes are on exterior spaces, click "Extract".

events.eventText: Alerted by the explosion, reinforcements arrive.

Trying to find out more about the background of your missions, the Empire decides to pursue the traitorous historian Lorn.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Double Agent” into play.

Even though you failed, you still managed to foil the Empire's plans enough that it decides to track you.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Into a Corner” into play.
Because the heroes claimed all captives, the heroes receive 25 credits per hero.
The threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
